byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

abstract: Campaign finance case set to go before Wisconsin State Supreme Court, in which special prosecutor has asked that at least one justice be recused, is bringing attention to issue of increased spending in judicial elections and conflicts of interests; court is to decide whether investigation can proceed into claims that Gov Scott Walker's campaign improperly coordinated spending by outside groups in elections in 2011 and 2012.
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court has scheduled arguments about a financing case that involves groups that spent millions backing some of the justices.

headline.main: Campaign Money Tests Wisconsin Justices’ Impartiality
headline.print_headline: Concerns Grow as Court Races Draw Big Cash

snippet: The State Supreme Court has scheduled arguments about a financing case that involves groups that spent millions backing some of the justices.
